page.title: 05Vernacular Architecture
page.content: The 4 manor houses are of Island stone with either sandstone tiles or else mainly clay tiles. Sandstone is often only used for the lower rows. The older cottages include traditional rural stone and thatch, the early 20th century houses are mainly brick and slate with asbestos tiles where the slate has been replaced, and modern bungalows and council houses are of reconstituted 'island stone'. There are no wooden residences. The farm houses were originally of Ventnor stone with thatched roofs later replaced with clay tiles or even sheets of corrugated iron on smaller, poorer farms.
